teal.render.j3d

Class BehaviorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.media.j3d.SceneGraphObject
      • javax.media.j3d.Node
        • javax.media.j3d.Leaf
          • javax.media.j3d.Behavior
            • teal.render.j3d.BehaviorManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransformChangeListener, TBehaviorManager

    public class BehaviorManager
extends javax.media.j3d.Behavior
implements TBehaviorManager
    A behavior class to process all viewer mouse events. It should be possible to provide default handlers for each of the types of behavior processing that needs to be done, or to be able to specify handlers for Pick, Translate, Rotate & Zoom.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.26 $

    • Constructor Detail

      • BehaviorManager

        public BehaviorManager()
        Initializes standard fields. Note that this behavior still needs a transform group to work on (use setTransformGroup(tg)) and the transform group must add this behavior.

      • BehaviorManager

        public BehaviorManager(int options)
        Initializes standard fields. Note that this behavior still needs a transform group to work on (use setTransformGroup(tg)) and the transform group must add this behavior.

      • BehaviorManager

        public BehaviorManager(javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup transformGroup)
        Creates a mouse behavior object with a given transform group, the group must be added to the scene.
        Parameters:
        transformGroup - The transform group to be manipulated.

      • setTransformGroup

        public void setTransformGroup(javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup transformGroup)
        Swap a new transformGroup replacing the old one. This allows manipulators to operate on different nodes. This may be any TransformGroup, but will most likely be a TransformGizmo.
        Parameters:
        transformGroup - The *new* transform group to be manipulated.
        See Also:
        TransformGizmo

      • wakeup

        public void wakeup()
        Manually wake up the behavior. If MANUAL_WAKEUP flag was set upon creation, you must wake up this behavior each time it is handled.
